mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A Synopsis of the Rattans (Arecaceae: Calamoideae) of Laos and Neighbouring Parts of Indochina

nomenclature.name: Calamus bousigonii subsp. bousigonii
nomenclature.author: Becc.
nomenclature.bibref: Evans et al. Rattans Lao PDR: 35 (2001)

div.p: Thailand (South-east), Vietnam (Cochinchina and South Annam) and Cambodia. This subspecies is an Indochinese endemic but the species also occurs in Peninsular Thailand and possibly northern Peninsular Malaysia (Saw L. G., pers. comm. 2000).
Evergreen forest. Up to 700 m in Vietnam and 1000 m in Cambodia.
Dransfield (2000) described populations from Peninsular Thailand as subsp. smitinandiiJ. Dransf. and also gave detailed information about the nominate form.
Unknown. The population in Peninsular Thailand is probably not threatened.
